item.title: US Election 2020: Biden and Trump make final pitches to voters
item.description: The candidates make last-ditch efforts to persuade voters in key states on the final day of campaigning.

item.title: US election: A wild three-year campaign in three minutes
item.description: Billions of dollars spent, dozens of candidates, two nominees, one pandemic - we take a look back.

item.title: Seven decades of Trump and Biden in pictures
item.description: The political and personal lives of the candidates over seven decades.

item.title: Vienna shooting: Austria launches manhunt after deadly 'terror' attack
item.description: Police say an armed suspect is on the run after an attack that left three people and a gunman dead.

item.title: Sri Lanka: Rescuers rush to save beached pilot whales
item.description: Around 100 pilot whales are stranded near the Sri Lankan capital Colombo.

item.title: US businesses brace for election unrest
item.description: Shopskeepers have been boarding up windows in anticipation of unrest.

item.title: T-cell response 'lasts six months after Covid infection'
item.description: But it is still not clear how much this protects people against being re-infected, experts say.

item.title: Indians asked to eat more sugar to tackle oversupply
item.description: India is already the world's biggest consumer of the sweetener

item.title: Chinese firm moves from adult diapers to face masks
item.description: Daddybaby has been given approval by British standards agency and EU to provide protective equipment.

item.title: Melbourne Cup 2020: Twilight Payment wins but Anthony Van Dyck is fatally injured
item.description: Twilight Payment gives Irish trainer Joseph O'Brien a second Melbourne Cup win but victory is overshadowed by the death of 2019 Derby winner Anthony Van Dyck.

item.title: Coronavirus: Germany restricts social life in 'lockdown light'
item.description: Tighter rules aim to curb Germany's Covid surge, but France's lockdown is tougher.

item.title: Turkey earthquake: Girl, three, pulled alive from rubble
item.description: A three-year-old girl is pulled alive from rubble in Turkey's port city of Izmir.

item.title: Van Gogh: Artist experienced 'delirium from alcohol withdrawal'
item.description: The artist likely suffered with delirium as a result of alcohol withdrawal, Dutch researchers say.

item.title: Coronavirus: Behind the scenes of developing a Covid-19 vaccine
item.description: Meet the scientists who use social media to show people what they do to develop a coronavirus vaccine in the lab.

item.title: Bushfire koalas going back to the wild
item.description: Thousands of creatures were killed and injured in last summer's blazes on South Australia's Kangaroo Island.

item.title: Three elders give advice for Trump and Biden
item.description: From deep in the Maasai lands of Kenya to high in the mountains of Tibet, we found this advice for Donald Trump and Joe Biden.

item.title: The Countdown: Lady Gaga gets drawn in as campaign heats up
item.description: The latest US election news in four sentences and how Lady Gaga got involved in an unusual debate.

item.title: In pictures: Day of the Dead in Covid times
item.description: With public events cancelled amid the pandemic, Mexico's Day of the Dead is low-key but poignant.

item.title: 'Living in America's cancer alley is like death row'
item.description: Data from the US Environmental Protection Agency suggests that those living in the area of St. James in Louisiana have the highest risk of getting cancer of anywhere in America.

item.title: Baby Shark becomes YouTube's most-watched video of all time
item.description: The children's song overtakes Latin pop smash Despacito to become the site's most-viewed video ever.

item.title: Ethnic Mongolians battle to keep their language and culture alive in China
item.description: A reduction in Mongolian language teaching has prompted rare protests in China’s northern border region.

item.title: Ant Group: How it became a financial giant
item.description: As China's Ant Group prepares for its stock market debut, we look at how it established its empire.

item.title: What if your pet could 'talk'?
item.description: It's hard enough training your dog to respond to "sit" but now there may be a new way for your pets to communicate.

item.title: Unmasking the Pyramid Kings - Crowd1 scam targets Africa
item.description: Behind the promises and the hype, Crowd1 hides some ugly truths, some wealthy scammers, and a whole pyramid of lies.

item.title: We want to live, overworked delivery drivers say
item.description: Families in South Korea are reeling after the deaths of 14 delivery workers this year from what they call overwork.

item.title: #EndSars protests: How Anthony Unuode gave his life for a better Nigeria
item.description: Nigerians pay tribute to #EndSars protester Anthony Unuode after he was killed in the capital.

item.title: Be a 'secret agent' and other new ways to exercise
item.description: Turning a run into an adventure is just one of the innovations in the exercise industry.

item.title: Geneva: Why the world's highest minimum wage was needed
item.description: Geneva is very wealthy, but not everyone is rich and now it has the world's highest minimum salary.

item.title: Could Israeli-Arab peace deals spark an arms race?
item.description: Potential US weapons sales are prompting warnings of a new cycle of proliferation, says Tom Bateman.

item.title: Churails: Why a feminist detective show was banned in Pakistan
item.description: A web series faces backlash in Pakistan for its bold subject matter and stereotype-smashing female leads.

item.title: Covid: What will the England lockdown achieve?
item.description: Lockdown is the measure nobody wanted but now many European countries have decided they need.

item.title: Vardy produces another 'masterclass' - but can Leicester fight for the title?
item.description: BBC Sport looks at why Leicester could be considered title challengers this season after another 'masterclass' performance from Jamie Vardy.

item.title: IPL: Delhi Capitals beat Royal Challengers Bangalore
item.description: Delhi Capitals ensure they will have two opportunities to reach the final of the Indian Premier League with a six-wicket defeat of Royal Challengers Bangalore, who also make the last four.

item.title: Lukaku ruled out of Inter's Champions League tie with Real
item.description: Inter Milan's top-scorer Romelu Lukaku will miss the Champions League tie against Real Madrid through injury.

item.title: Who kept his mum and dad happy - and made Garth Crooks' team of the week?
item.description: Who kept his parents happy? Who is in fantastic form? Will history repeat itself? Garth Crooks names his team of the week.

item.title: 'We have to work hard - if not, we have no chance': Is trouble ahead for West Brom boss Bilic?
item.description: West Brom boss Slaven Bilic was very critical of his side's display in their defeat at Fulham, but is there more trouble ahead?

item.title: US election 2020: What to look out for on election night
item.description: Americans will pick their next president on 3 November. Here's what to look for as results roll in.

item.title: How to follow the election on the BBC
item.description: Find out how to stay in touch with live election results on TV, radio, online, and on social media.

item.title: Why we might have to wait for the result
item.description: A surge in postal ballots, legal disputes and stubborn candidates could delay the results.

item.title: A really simple guide to the election
item.description: If you’re looking for a refresher or trying to understand it for the first time, this guide will help.

item.title: US election 2020: The people behind the political memes you share
item.description: A handful of people are behind most of the politics shared on Facebook - none of them politicians.

item.title: US election: What's the worst that could happen?
item.description: Trump and Biden voters tell us their greatest fears about their candidate losing the election.

item.title: US election 2020: Does climate change impact the vote?
item.description: Two Republicans, one Democrat and one independent voter talk about climate change.

item.title: Predict the president 2020: Will Trump or Biden win the US election? You decide
item.description: Play our game to predict whether Donald Trump or Joe Biden will win the key states in the election.

item.title: US election 2020: Why does the vote matter to people in UK?
item.description: How could a Trump or a Biden win have an impact on the lives of people in the UK?

item.title: US election 2020: What are Trump's and Biden's policies?
item.description: Some of President Trump's and Joe Biden's key policies explained and compared.

item.title: Who is ahead - Biden or Trump?
item.description: An in-depth look at the polls and what they can and can’t tell us about who will win the White House.
